section.section: In this section the following words have the meanings indicated.

"Demonstration" means one or more persons demonstrating, picketing, speechmaking, marching, holding a vigil, or engaging in any other similar conduct that involves the communication or expression of views or grievances and that has the effect, intent, or propensity to attract a crowd or onlookers.
"Demonstration" does not include the casual use of property by visitors or tourists that does not have the intent or propensity to attract a crowd or onlookers.
"Firearm" means a handgun, rifle, shotgun, short-barreled rifle, short-barreled shotgun, or any other firearm, whether loaded or unloaded.
"Firearm" does not include an antique firearm.
"Handgun" has the meaning stated in § 5-101 of the Public Safety Article.
"Public place" means a place to which the general public has access and a right to resort for business, entertainment, or other lawful purpose.
"Public place" is not limited to a place devoted solely to the uses of the public.
This subsection does not apply to a law enforcement officer.

A person may not have a firearm in the person's possession or on or about the person at a demonstration in a public place or in a vehicle that is within 1,000 feet of a demonstration in a public place after:
the person has been advised by a law enforcement officer that a demonstration is occurring at the public place; and
the person has been ordered by the law enforcement officer to leave the area of the demonstration until the person disposes of the firearm.

text.section: A person who violates this section is guilty of a misdemeanor and on conviction is subject to imprisonment not exceeding 1 year or a fine not exceeding $1,000 or both.
